trans-unit.source: Deploying a Driver to a Test Computer
trans-unit.target: Deploying a Driver to a Test Computer

trans-unit.source: Taking advantage of the Visual Studio development environment, the WDK provides a test feature that enables you to build, deploy, and debug a driver on a test computer.
trans-unit.target: Taking advantage of the Visual Studio development environment, the WDK provides a test feature that enables you to build, deploy, and debug a driver on a test computer.

trans-unit.source: To successfully deploy a driver to a test system using the WDK, you must first set up and configure a test computer.
trans-unit.target: To successfully deploy a driver to a test system using the WDK, you must first set up and configure a test computer.

trans-unit.source: You can set up and configure multiple computers if you want to test your driver under different testing scenarios.
trans-unit.target: You can set up and configure multiple computers if you want to test your driver under different testing scenarios.

trans-unit.source: Setting up the test computer
trans-unit.target: Setting up the test computer

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions for [Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 10)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Dn745909).
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions for [Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 10)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Dn745909).

trans-unit.source: **Note** If you run into difficulties setting up the test computer, see [Troubleshooting Configuration of Driver Deployment, Testing and Debugging](troubleshooting_configuration_of_driver_deployment__testing_and_debugging.md).
trans-unit.target: **Note** If you run into difficulties setting up the test computer, see [Troubleshooting Configuration of Driver Deployment, Testing and Debugging](troubleshooting_configuration_of_driver_deployment__testing_and_debugging.md).

trans-unit.source: Setting deployment properties for your driver solution
trans-unit.target: Setting deployment properties for your driver solution

trans-unit.source: From the property pages for your driver package, you have additional control over how you want your driver deployed for testing.
trans-unit.target: From the property pages for your driver package, you have additional control over how you want your driver deployed for testing.

trans-unit.source: You can choose to deploy the driver automatically whenever you build the driver solution in each configuration.
trans-unit.target: You can choose to deploy the driver automatically whenever you build the driver solution in each configuration.

trans-unit.source: Open the property pages for your driver package.
trans-unit.target: Open the property pages for your driver package.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the driver package project in Solution Explorer and select **Properties**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the driver package project in Solution Explorer and select **Properties**.

trans-unit.source: In the property pages for the driver package, click **Configuration Properties**, click **Driver Install**, and then click **Deployment**.
trans-unit.target: In the property pages for the driver package, click **Configuration Properties**, click **Driver Install**, and then click **Deployment**.

trans-unit.source: Select the **Enable deployment** option.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Enable deployment** option.

trans-unit.source: When this option is selected, you must select a test computer that you have configured, or select the name of a computer that you want to configure for testing.
trans-unit.target: When this option is selected, you must select a test computer that you have configured, or select the name of a computer that you want to configure for testing.

trans-unit.source: See [Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 10)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Dn745909).
trans-unit.target: See [Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 10)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Dn745909).

trans-unit.source: When you enable deployment for your driver package project, the driver is automatically deployed to the test computer you have selected when you build your solution.
trans-unit.target: When you enable deployment for your driver package project, the driver is automatically deployed to the test computer you have selected when you build your solution.

trans-unit.source: You can use the **Deployment** property page to configure options for driver installation and deployment.
trans-unit.target: You can use the **Deployment** property page to configure options for driver installation and deployment.

trans-unit.source: See [Deployment Properties for Driver Package Projects](deployment_properties_for_driver_projects.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Deployment Properties for Driver Package Projects](deployment_properties_for_driver_projects.md).

trans-unit.source: When you enable deployment on a test computer, you can also automatically enable and configure [Driver Verifier](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff545448), KMDF Verifier, or UMDF Verifier on the test computer to enhance the effectiveness of testing.
trans-unit.target: When you enable deployment on a test computer, you can also automatically enable and configure [Driver Verifier](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff545448), KMDF Verifier, or UMDF Verifier on the test computer to enhance the effectiveness of testing.

trans-unit.source: To set these options for the driver package project, click **Configuration Properties**, click **Driver Install**, and then click the following property pages.
trans-unit.target: To set these options for the driver package project, click **Configuration Properties**, click **Driver Install**, and then click the following property pages.

trans-unit.source: Driver Verifier Properties for Driver Package Projects
trans-unit.target: Driver Verifier Properties for Driver Package Projects

trans-unit.source: KMDF Verifier Properties for Driver Package Projects
trans-unit.target: KMDF Verifier Properties for Driver Package Projects

trans-unit.source: UMDF Verifier Properties for Driver Package Projects
trans-unit.target: UMDF Verifier Properties for Driver Package Projects

trans-unit.source: Building a driver and deploying the driver to test computer
trans-unit.target: Building a driver and deploying the driver to test computer

trans-unit.source: Before you deploy your driver, make sure that you can build your driver solution.
trans-unit.target: Before you deploy your driver, make sure that you can build your driver solution.

trans-unit.source: A driver solution must include the driver and driver package so that the driver can be installed on the test computer.
trans-unit.target: A driver solution must include the driver and driver package so that the driver can be installed on the test computer.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Creating a Driver Package](creating_a_driver_package.md) and [Building a Driver](building_a_driver.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Creating a Driver Package](creating_a_driver_package.md) and [Building a Driver](building_a_driver.md).

trans-unit.source: Before you deploy the driver to the test computer, you also need to sign the driver package.
trans-unit.target: Before you deploy the driver to the test computer, you also need to sign the driver package.

trans-unit.source: See [Signing a Driver During Development and Testing](signing_a_driver_during_development_and_testing.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Signing a Driver During Development and Testing](signing_a_driver_during_development_and_testing.md).

trans-unit.source: Select the test computer that you have configured.
trans-unit.target: Select the test computer that you have configured.

trans-unit.source: To deploy the driver, click **Build Solution** or **Deploy Solution** from the **Build** menu, or press **F5** to build, deploy, and start debugging.
trans-unit.target: To deploy the driver, click **Build Solution** or **Deploy Solution** from the **Build** menu, or press **F5** to build, deploy, and start debugging.

trans-unit.source: When you deploy a driver, the driver files are copied to the %Systemdrive%\\drivertest\\drivers folder on the test computer.
trans-unit.target: When you deploy a driver, the driver files are copied to the %Systemdrive%\\drivertest\\drivers folder on the test computer.

trans-unit.source: If something goes wrong during deployment, you can check to see if the files are copied to the test computer.
trans-unit.target: If something goes wrong during deployment, you can check to see if the files are copied to the test computer.

trans-unit.source: Verify that the .inf, .cat, test cert, and .sys files, and any other necessary files, are present %systemdrive%\\drivertest\\drivers folder.
trans-unit.target: Verify that the .inf, .cat, test cert, and .sys files, and any other necessary files, are present %systemdrive%\\drivertest\\drivers folder.

trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting driver deployment
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting driver deployment

trans-unit.source: Here are some tips for troubleshooting driver deployment to a test computer when you use Visual Studio and the WDK.
trans-unit.target: Here are some tips for troubleshooting driver deployment to a test computer when you use Visual Studio and the WDK.

trans-unit.source: Deployment fails due to Error code: 2
trans-unit.target: Deployment fails due to Error code: 2

trans-unit.source: Add the following registry key:
trans-unit.target: Add the following registry key:

trans-unit.source: HKLM\Software\Microsoft\DriverTest\Service
trans-unit.target: HKLM\Software\Microsoft\DriverTest\Service

trans-unit.source: Under this key, create a DWORD value **DebugSession**, and set it to 0.
trans-unit.target: Under this key, create a DWORD value **DebugSession**, and set it to 0.

trans-unit.source: You only need to set this value once, and it persists for future deployments.
trans-unit.target: You only need to set this value once, and it persists for future deployments.

trans-unit.source: Can't find the deployment properties for the driver project
trans-unit.target: Can't find the deployment properties for the driver project

trans-unit.source: The deployment properties are only available if you have a driver package.
trans-unit.target: The deployment properties are only available if you have a driver package.

trans-unit.source: If your driver solution does not have a driver package project, you need to add one.
trans-unit.target: If your driver solution does not have a driver package project, you need to add one.

trans-unit.source: The driver package contains components, such as the INF file that are needed for installation.
trans-unit.target: The driver package contains components, such as the INF file that are needed for installation.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Driver Packages](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff544840) and [Creating a Driver Package](creating_a_driver_package.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Driver Packages](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff544840) and [Creating a Driver Package](creating_a_driver_package.md).

trans-unit.source: Afer you have added the driver package, you can right-click the driver package project in Solution Explorer and select **Properties**.
trans-unit.target: Afer you have added the driver package, you can right-click the driver package project in Solution Explorer and select **Properties**.

trans-unit.source: In the property pages for the driver package, click **Configuration Properties**, click **Driver Install**, and then click **Deployment**.
trans-unit.target: In the property pages for the driver package, click **Configuration Properties**, click **Driver Install**, and then click **Deployment**.

trans-unit.source: Problems selecting, configuring or locating the target computer
trans-unit.target: Problems selecting, configuring or locating the target computer

trans-unit.source: For instruction on how to set up the target computer, using Windows Driver Kit (WDK) 8.1 and Windows Driver Kit (WDK) 8, see [Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 10)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Dn745909).
trans-unit.target: For instruction on how to set up the target computer, using Windows Driver Kit (WDK) 8.1 and Windows Driver Kit (WDK) 8, see [Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 10)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Dn745909).

trans-unit.source: If you have problems with provisioning the target computer, see [Troubleshooting Configuration of Driver Deployment, Testing and Debugging](troubleshooting_configuration_of_driver_deployment__testing_and_debugging.md).
trans-unit.target: If you have problems with provisioning the target computer, see [Troubleshooting Configuration of Driver Deployment, Testing and Debugging](troubleshooting_configuration_of_driver_deployment__testing_and_debugging.md).

trans-unit.source: If the target computer is running an N or KN version of Windows, you must install the Media Feature Pack for N and KN versions of Windows.
trans-unit.target: If the target computer is running an N or KN version of Windows, you must install the Media Feature Pack for N and KN versions of Windows.

trans-unit.source: See [Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 10)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Dn745909) for more information.
trans-unit.target: See [Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 10)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Dn745909) for more information.

trans-unit.source: Problems installing the driver on 64-bit version of Windows
trans-unit.target: Problems installing the driver on 64-bit version of Windows

trans-unit.source: Starting with Windows Vista, all 64-bit versions of Windows require driver code to have a digital signature for the driver to load.
trans-unit.target: Starting with Windows Vista, all 64-bit versions of Windows require driver code to have a digital signature for the driver to load.

trans-unit.source: See [Signing a Driver](signing_a_driver.md) and [Signing a Driver During Development and Testing](signing_a_driver_during_development_and_testing.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Signing a Driver](signing_a_driver.md) and [Signing a Driver During Development and Testing](signing_a_driver_during_development_and_testing.md).

trans-unit.source: Problems installing the driver (general)
trans-unit.target: Problems installing the driver (general)

trans-unit.source: The WDK can deploy and install a driver package on a test computer, but only if the driver has all the necessary components for installation, such as an INF file.
trans-unit.target: The WDK can deploy and install a driver package on a test computer, but only if the driver has all the necessary components for installation, such as an INF file.

trans-unit.source: See [Driver Packages](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff544840) more information.
trans-unit.target: See [Driver Packages](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff544840) more information.

trans-unit.source: Make sure you can install the driver outside of Visual Studio and the WDK.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you can install the driver outside of Visual Studio and the WDK.

trans-unit.source: For example, use the Device Console utility, [Devcon](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff544707) to test whether you can install the driver.
trans-unit.target: For example, use the Device Console utility, [Devcon](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff544707) to test whether you can install the driver.

trans-unit.source: Make sure the device (if you have one) is connected to the target computer.
trans-unit.target: Make sure the device (if you have one) is connected to the target computer.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Device and Driver Installation](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff549731) and [Creating a Driver Package](creating_a_driver_package.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Device and Driver Installation](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff549731) and [Creating a Driver Package](creating_a_driver_package.md).
